sections.title: Mission and services
sections.summary: Fixnado connects enterprise buyers and specialist crews through a single marketplace.

clauses.heading: Why Fixnado exists
content: Fixnado orchestrates field service delivery across repairs, maintenance, installations, rentals, and materials. We combine intelligent scheduling, escrow-backed payments, compliance workflows, and analytics so enterprises can operate resilient service programmes without managing fragmented suppliers.

Our platform supports procurement teams, facilities managers, housing associations, construction firms, utilities, and local government bodies who require dependable, auditable service delivery at scale.

clauses.heading: Core capabilities
content: Fixnado offers automated sourcing, crew management, timeline hub communications, e-signature contracts, real-time job telemetry, dispute resolution, and financial reconciliation. Customers access the platform via web, mobile apps, and APIs.

Providers use Fixnado to manage crews, accept work, publish storefronts, track cash flow, and maintain compliance artefacts. Our intelligence layer recommends crews based on skills, location, availability, and performance.

sections.title: Governance and compliance
sections.summary: Blackwellen Ltd oversees Fixnado operations with rigorous governance.

clauses.heading: Company information
content: Fixnado is operated by Blackwellen Ltd, a company registered in England and Wales under company number 13847592. We maintain offices in London, Manchester, Glasgow, and Dublin with on-call teams providing 24/7 support.

We hold ISO/IEC 27001 aligned security controls, conduct annual penetration testing, and maintain GDPR-compliant data governance frameworks. Independent auditors review our financial and operational controls annually.

clauses.heading: Ethics and sustainability
content: Fixnadoâ€™s supplier code of conduct covers health and safety, labour practices, anti-corruption, and sustainability metrics. Providers attest to compliance during onboarding and through periodic audits.

Our sustainability programme targets carbon-neutral operations by 2026. We prioritise local sourcing, invest in electric vehicle logistics, and run circular economy initiatives to refurbish materials removed during works.

sections.title: Leadership and partners
sections.summary: Overview of the teams responsible for delivering the Fixnado roadmap.

clauses.heading: Executive team
content: The executive team spans operations, technology, trust & safety, customer success, finance, and compliance. Each executive sponsors a cross-functional guild that monitors KPIs and risk indicators.
Advisory councils comprising enterprise clients, providers, and technicians review roadmap priorities quarterly to ensure Fixnado delivers measurable value.

clauses.heading: Strategic partners
content: Fixnado integrates with logistics firms, manufacturers, insurers, and financing providers to deliver turnkey solutions. Partnerships include solar and EV installers, property management firms, and smart building platforms.
We operate marketplace enablement programmes for regional specialists, apprenticeships, and social enterprises to ensure equitable access to work opportunities.
